docs.snippet: DUNKIRK, Oct. 16 -- Only one man is known to have escaped from the steamer Dean Richmond, which foundered in Lake Erie Saturday. He was found on the beach near Van Buren Point to-day. His haggard face and sunken eyes told a story of terrible suffe...
docs.abstract: Dean Richmond Wrecked with Crew in Lake Erie
docs.lead_paragraph: DUNKIRK, Oct. 16 -- Only one man is known to have escaped from the steamer Dean Richmond, which foundered in Lake Erie Saturday. He was found on the beach near Van Buren Point to-day. His haggard face and sunken eyes told a story of terrible suffering. He was aimlessly wandering up and down the beach, and when spoken to burst into tears, and said he was looking for his dog.

headline.main: ONE MAN SAVED HIS LIFE; STORY OF A SURVIVOR FROM THE WRECKED DEAN RICHMOND. Washed Overboard Some Time Before the Steamer Foundered -- Met Wandering on the Beach Looking for His Pet Dog -- Found the Poor Brute at Last, Dead Under a Boat Which Had Come Ashore -- Three Searchers for Bodies Drowned -- Other Lake Disasters.

docs.snippet: ASBURY PARK, N.J., Feb. 10. The schooner ThomAs G. Smith, Capt. Corson, from Georgetown, S.C., for New-York, came ashore at Shark River, one mile and a half south of Asbury park, at 3 o'clock this morning. She is loaded with naval stores, cotton, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASBURY PARK, N.J., Feb. 10. The schooner ThomAs G. Smith, Capt. Corson, from Georgetown, S.C., for New-York, came ashore at Shark River, one mile and a half south of Asbury park, at 3 o'clock this morning. She is loaded with naval stores, cotton, rice, and spirits. She left Georgetown Jan. 31, and has experienced rough weather.

headline.main: MARINE DISASTERS.; A VESSEL STRANDED BY MAKING FOR A PATROLMAN'S LIGHT AN ITALIAN BARKASHORE NEAR CAPE HENRY.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Mass., Dec. 5.--A cable dispatch receives herw states that the ship Quintero, Capt. Mauning from Iquique, for Boston, sank after a collision with another vessel when off Cape Saint Roque Dec. 3. All the crew, except one, were saved.

docs.snippet: Insurers paid out around $50 billion for natural disaster claims last year, almost double 2015's payout of $27 billion, reinsurer Munich Re said in its annual natural catastrophe review on Wednesday....

docs.snippet: Heart surgeons, or heart cutters as they seem to be known to each other, are practitioners of a particularly mysterious and admirable set of skills. They know how to do things that are beyond the imaginings of people who aren't doctors, and what t...
docs.abstract: T Thompson book Hearts. Of Surgeons and Transplants, Miracles and Disasters Along the Cardiac Frontier revd; sketch
docs.lead_paragraph: Heart surgeons, or heart cutters as they seem to be known to each other, are practitioners of a particularly mysterious and admirable set of skills. They know how to do things that are beyond the imaginings of people who aren't doctors, and what they do is go peculiarly connected with life and death they have an aura, even in their profession.

headline.main: Hearts; Of Surgeons and Transplants, Miracles and Disasters Along the Cardiac Frontier. By Thomas Thompson. 304 pp. New York: McCall Publishing Co. $7.95.
